name: Shinta Mani Club Siem Reap

reviews.text: I am just finishing up my 4-night stay at the Club property. Cold fragrant towels each time you step foot back at the hotel. Cold bottles of water each time you depart. Smiles and sincere greetings from staff. I felt appreciated as a guest (a rare thing). Breakfast is simply outstanding, including sparkling wine! Free minibar with Cokes, soda water, beer, water, juices and nuts. Laundry done perfectly and same day. Nightly turn down with a treat. In room tea and coffee. Good safe that fit my laptop. iPod dock (you'll need to bring an adapter if you have iPhone 5 or higher). Nice music playing when you enter room the first time. Lovely lotus flower arrangement in room. 2 oranges in room for your enjoyment with plate, napkin and utensils. Bed is wonderfully comfortable. Plenty of hot water and powerful A/C. Great linens. Comfy bed. Little noise (and I was right across from restaurant and bar). If you can't find the hairdryer, it's in a drawer in the wardrobe. No need for adapter as electrical outlets accept US standard plugs (ensure you don't need a converter before you plug in, of course!). Nice lap pool; cold drinking water just materializes when you sit in a lounge chair. If I'm in Siem Reap ever again, I will stay here.
reviews.title: Really Top Notch
Zen
reviews.text: Shinta Mani= zen,peaceful,tranquil,friendly staff,smiley faces,
the foundation,giving back,social responsibility ,the "made in Cambodia"market,
reviews.title: A Truly Outstanding Hotel
An oasis after a full day of "templing" on the heat...
reviews.text: design,art,lovely rooms,coffee,cookies....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Missing= lounge area,happy hour
reviews.title: Really outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Shinta Mani at the end of October 2013 and absolutely loved it. The hotel has a very cool boutique vibe- lots of great art and modern styling. They also help the locals by providing free room to students while they are attending certain programs, which is pretty amazing.
reviews.title: Cool hotel close to the action

reviews.text: The rooms are a good size, we had one on the main floor which was cool because it had it's own private courtyard entrance. The beds are really comfortable and there was plenty of hot water and really good air-conditioning -- something some of us take for granted until we go to places like Cambodia where it's 100 degrees every day and night.
reviews.title: Good but not for the price

reviews.text: Breakfast was included each morning and the selections were good. Our favorite part was the swing tables in the front - we sat there every morning. Also you are only a 5 minute walk from the hustle and bustle of the markets in town.
reviews.title: Absolute prefection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly and polite. While it's true that some of them don't speak very good English, it's absurd to assume that in a country like Cambodia, where people are quite poor, that hotel staff would be proficient in English. We didn't find this to be a problem at all.
reviews.title: Stunning design, fablous staff

reviews.text: I would come back to this hotel in a heartbeat - loved it.
reviews.title: PERFECT SIEM REAP STAY

reviews.text: It has been a good while since I stayed at the Shinta Mani, but I just noticed that I had not yet reviewed it - and it was one of the highlights of my month-long vacation in Vietnam, Cambodia & Thailand. I could not leave it out!
reviews.title: Simply adorable

likes.liked: — Comfy rooms, pretty pool & spa area, delightful staff
likes.disliked: — Internet access spotty, but not a big deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the staff friendly and eager to please (they welcomed us with a Shinta Mani silk scarf!), and the spa is wonderful and very reasonably priced - a little oasis! The beautiful swimming pool was just outside my hotel room door, and was a mood-altering necessilty after storming the temples of Angkor for hours in the 113 degree heat! The restaurant area was very cute and the food was all very fresh and delicious. Lots of small touches to make everything special!
reviews.title: Shinta Mani, A Beautiful Hotel

likes.liked: — Qiuiet, small, 18 rooms, and community projects

reviews.text: The staff was able to pair my group with a knowledgable local guide (with air-conditioned van!) to help us navigate the temples - providing wonderful color to the tour and helping us time our visits to each temple for crowd- and sun-avaoidance!
reviews.title: Not bad...

reviews.text: Aside from this being a great hotel in a wonderful location, it is a training ground for Cambodians interested in careers in the hospitality industry.
reviews.title: Great small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small elegant hotel on a quiet street, service, food, staff excellent and very professional. Close to attractions with Tuks Tuks available at the front of the hotel. Rooms are spotless, well presented, would recommend it to any one. 5Star.
reviews.title: Shinta Mani- a Shangrila in Siem Reap :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel after reading about in in Grazia magazine. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Great hotel, lovely staff and added feel-good factor

likes.liked: — The fact that you are helping the staff through the hotels learning institute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is in a convenient location, walking distance to the centre of Siem Reap and the rooms are extremely comfortable, with nice beds, sofa, TV, free wireless and air con. The pool area is small but sufficient, as most people spend the day at the temples. We probably spent more time at the hotel than most due to the fact I am pregnant and my husband was sick one day.
reviews.title: Superb!

likes.liked: — Great all round accomodation from which to visit the temple sites of Cambodia. Good value for the price paid.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa is nice, but does seem expensive compared to other costs in Cambodia. A facial was $41 for 1.5 hours.
reviews.title: Disappointed with Shinta Mani

reviews.text: There is a lack of piping hot water in the shower, luke-warm is probably a better description, but that seemed to be the case everywhere we stayed in Cambodia, not just this hotel, and is really not a big issue when you see how many locals live.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant does a good breakfast with plenty of variety, and fabulous pastries, however for evening meals it again seems expensive compared to restaurants in Siem Reap centre. We ate here one night, and two bowls of pasta, a fruit juice, some water and a fruit salad was $31, which was our most expensive (and not our best!) meal.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel That We Highly Recommend

likes.liked: — It's clean, the staff is wonderful and the beds to die for!
likes.disliked: — Bring your own hair conditioner ladies!

reviews.text: This wonderful hotel is a small gem in the heart of Siem Reap. The staff is extremely helpful and always available. The rooms are large, airy, and very comfortable and clean. There is a large library/porch on the second floor with internet access. The staff was attentive to the point of remembering our drink and breakfast orders daily (three of us were there for 5 days). Any and all requests were attended to immediately and cheerfully. We stayed in hotels in Hong Kong, Ubud, and Nusa Dua on this trip, and this was definitely our favorite.
reviews.title: A wonderful gem in Siem Reap

reviews.text: Shina Mani is a lovely hotel with very helpful, charming staff who are also more professional than you will encounter at other hotels in Cambodia.
reviews.title: Third stay and still happy

reviews.text: Breakfast is always good and broadband was working very well (also a bonus in Cambodia).
reviews.title: Delightful boutique

reviews.text: Some of the rooms need a spruce-up soon - particularly the weird shower attachments.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel & Staff!!

likes.liked: — Clean, great people, friendly staff, Institute of hospitality program

reviews.text: Spa is always fantastic and you must take time for a massage.
reviews.title: Beware ... Looks and reviews can be very deceptive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Siem Reap is an amazing place with nice people, great Angkor Wat, and every thing with good price. Shinta Mani definitely contributes. Very impressed with the hospitality of Shinta Mani. Good staff, good food, service. We stayed from Nov 3 - 7 for 4 nights in garden pool access room. It is the best hotel ever visited. Staff serve us with heart, unexpected service like twice room cleaning per day, choices of breakfast, soft drink for swim, welcome cookies per day...all these surprise me and my wife. Special thanks to Savoey for his kind input and booking of dinner! Thank you.
reviews.title: Shinta Mani polish my trip in Siem Reap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Shinta Mani Siem Reap. Not much to say really. It's very simple, best hotel experience I have ever had in Cambodia, best hotel experience I have ever had anywhere really. Amazing facilities, better than expected food, great pool, wonderful relaxing room, but mostly truly world class caring careful attentive staff. I can not say enough good about this place so I will leave it at this, Simply The Best. Brilliant. Thank you Shinta Mani.
reviews.title: Simply The Best

reviews.text: I chose to stay at Shinta Mani because of its modern, stylish and clean environment. I am a frequent traveler with high expectations. I had high expectations of this hotel. When we arrived, we were elated to find that this hotel did not just fulfill our expectations but the friendly service staff that greeted us at the entrance, the front desk as well as, the rest of the staff that we met along the way, were warm, engaging and, most importantly, they were smiling. The room was spacious and very clean. I was impressed by the fresh scent of flowers when we entered. So warm and so welcoming.
reviews.title: Service beyond my expectations

reviews.text: I would really recommend Shinta Mani if you want a pleasant getaway whenever you visit Cambodia. Amazing!
reviews.title: The model of excellence...

reviews.text: We chose the Shinta Mani Club hotel based on trip advisor reviews, and even the glowing reviews don't adequately describe how great it was to stay here. I have never received service like this! The staff are warm, genuine, and caring. They show amazing attention to detail in everything from flower arrangements, cool, scented towels on your return, housekeeping, nightly turndown, and more. We were almost embarrassed by the kindness and attention. We arrived on a late night flight from Seoul, and they picked us up, checked us in on the ride to the hotel, walked us directly to our room, and even called to make sure we didn't need a late-night snack. Daily breakfast was included in our room rate, and it was a hotel breakfast worth mentioning! There was a well-edited menu of Asian and western choices, with accompaniments served in a continental-style buffet. Coffee was perfect, and a mimosa or glass of champagne complemented the array of seasonal fruit; the pastries and fresh bread were outstanding. The atmosphere is elegant, yet comfortable, with thoughtful and photo-worthy details everywhere. We especially enjoyed the peppermint and bergamot scented passageways. The saltwater pools were a delightful way to relax after a day of temple-hopping. Our room was quiet and comfortable, with every amenity that we could want. We stayed 7 nights with our 7-year old daughter, and would have been happy to stay a week more!
reviews.title: Delightful Experience

reviews.text: Where do I start? I normally don't write reviews. In fact, I made a tripsdvisor account so that I could write a review for this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing staff, exceptional service, gorgeous hotel!
Ms
reviews.text: This hotel, by far, has been one of the best hotels I have stayed at so far. Without a doubt the service that I received here was incredible - I don't know if I received service like this before, and I have stayed at many many hotels. The entire staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. They truly go above and beyond expectations.

The hotel even has their own tuk Tuks parked outside waiting for guests. These tuk Tuks charged the same as any other tuk tuk so there was no sense of overcharging, even these drivers were accommodating!
reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: The hotel is gorgeous with great ambiance. And best of all the hotel gives back to their community with their program they run. I had the experience of seeing a graduation for kids that completed the shinta mani foundation - it was very motivational even to myself. And made me that much happier that I booked my hotel.
reviews.title: Bar None, Fab Hotel in Siem Reap
Perfect!
reviews.text: As for location couldn't be happier, 2-3 blocks from shopping and about 10 or 15 min drive to angkor wat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really wanted to rate Shinta Mani as a 5-star choice. After all, how often do you get to stay in a hotel where a portion of the profits are funding a school? Shinta Mani runs a Hospitality Institute, which trains young Cambodians for jobs in the hotel industry. Almost all of the 4 (so far) graduating classes have found jobs, quite an accomplishment in a poor country like Cambodia. Guests are invited (in a very, very low-key way) to make a donation to the school, which we did. We were that impressed with the work they're doing.
reviews.title: I wish I could rate it higher

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But at the end of the day the hotel has to earn its rating. First, the good: The staff at Shinta Mani are accommodating, extremely friendly and eager to take care of you. They will make reservations for you, hire drivers, whatever you need. You only have to ask. The restaurant serves an excellent buffet breakfast (included with the room), lunch and dinner. We ate there a couple of times and the food was very good. The rooms (we stayed in 2 different rooms) were spacious and very comfortably furnished.
reviews.title: Delightful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the bad: The air conditioning in both rooms was marginal. I would estimate that the temperature never got below 75 or so. This was especially troubling at night, because the only cover on the bed was a goose down duvet. We asked to have someone look at the a/c in both rooms. They did, but there was no improvement. In the second room we stayed in, the overhead shower did not work, though the hand-held shower did. The telephone in the second room did not work. The complimentary wifi was nice when it worked, which was about half the time.
reviews.title: Super Duper

reviews.text: Good as it is, Shinta Mani has a little ways to go before it rates 5 stars.
reviews.title: Shinta Mani is a very special place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We very much enjoyed our stay here (in one of the standard rooms). We had a laptop so enjoyed the free wifi internet access. The service here is top class as you would expect. We thought the location was great, just round the corner from the FCC (fantastic margaritas) and within walking distance (10 mins) of pub street & all the restaurants there - although there were always tuk tuks available outside the hotel if you don't want to walk. Excellent breakfasts and we ate a couple of times in the restaurant - the salads are superb.
reviews.title: Small but cosy and outstanding friendly and quiet hotel

likes.liked: — small hotel with large nicely and tastefully decorated rooms, very helpful staff and excellent ambiance

description: Shinta Mani Siem Reap is an upscale boutique property in the French Quarter of Siem Reap town. It boasts 39 contemporary designed rooms and public spaces in a European style with Khmer inspiriration. This exceptional hotel enjoys a tranquil and leafy setting just a 15 minute tuktuk ride from the magnificent temples of Angkor Wat.Shinta Mani, with a culture of Open Doors, Open Hearts, reflects its commitment to responsible tourism. The staff hope that during your visit you will open your heart to the beauty of the Kingdom of Cambodia, its gentle people and its fascinating culture.
